FuncDef:
The if-match source-port command configures a filtering rule based on the source port number.
The undo if-match source-port command deletes the filtering rule based on the source port number.
By default, no filtering rule based on the source port number is configured.
CLIs: undo if-match source-port { greater-than | less-than | equal } <port>

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the source port number is greater than the specified one.
-

Indicates that the source port number is smaller than the specified one.
-

Indicates that the source port number is equal to the specified one.
-

Specifies the source port number of the traffic.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Specifies the upper limit of a source port number.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The if-match source-port command is used to configure a filtering rule based on the source port number for a BGP (IPv6) Flow Specification route or BGP (IPv6) VPN Flow Specification route. Traffic matching the filtering rule will be controlled with the action specified by the apply clause.
Prerequisites
A static BGP (IPv6) Flow Specification route or BGP (IPv6) VPN Flow Specification route has been created using the flow-route command in the system view.
Precautions
Make sure that the source port number is within the range, because if the source port number is beyond the range, protocol packets sent by the source port cannot be forwarded.
A maximum of five filtering rules based on the source port number can be configured for a BGP Flow Specification route.
